channel.title: üè¢ Columbia University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Columbia University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Extensive-Form Game Solving via Blackwell Approachability on Treeplexes
item.description: First algorithmic framework for Blackwell approachability on treeplexes, enabling stepsize-invariant EFG solvers with state-of-the-art convergence rates.

item.title: Fair Secretaries with Unfair Predictions
item.description: Fair algorithms can leverage biased predictions to improve performance while guaranteeing fairness for all candidates.

item.title: Local Anti-Concentration Class: Logarithmic Regret for Greedy Linear Contextual Bandit
item.description: Greedy algorithms for linear contextual bandits achieve poly-logarithmic regret under the novel Local Anti-Concentration condition, expanding applicable distributions beyond Gaussians and uniforms.

item.title: The Fine-Grained Complexity of Gradient Computation for Training Large Language Models
item.description: New research precisely defines the computational limits of training large language models, revealing a sharp threshold based on parameter matrix entries, paving the way for faster algorithms.
